sentence: Filter per tile sequence quality; Heys! I'm working with whole-genome sequencing of a non-model organism and I was checking the quality of the data with FastQC. As I found that my per tile sequence quality was bad, I started looking for other softwares to filter my data. That's when I found fastp, and now I'm filtering all my data with your software. However, as I obtained a failure with FastQC in the tile's section and fastp does not provide (as far as I know) any information about it, I reran FastQC after running fastp on my data and the tile's failure was still there. . How could I filter by tiles with Fastp? Thanks,. Gabriel

sentence: Versioning; Hey,. I would like to lock the version of the `fastp` linux binary I am using when downloading it from `http://opengene.org/fastp/fastp`. Is it possible to include the respective version in the URI - . `0.21.0` as of now - and if not, could you please include it? Another way could be to tag the newest version here in the repo - I think the last version tag is `0.20.1`. Thanks a lot! Martin

sentence: If I use fastp on a couple of paired-end samples iteratively, I keep reducing the number of outputted reads; Strange behaviour, does it makes sense?:. step 1: . **fastp -i 1.fastq.gz -I 2.fastq.gz -o 1_1.fastq.gz -O 2_1.fastq.gz**. step 2: . **fastp -i 1_1.fastq.gz -I 2_1.fastq.gz -o 1_2.fastq.gz -O 2_2.fastq.gz**. Total number of reads for:. 1.fastq.gz = 214750. 1_2.fastq.gz = 214748. 1_3.fastq.gz = 214727. 2.fastq.gz = 214100. 2_1.fastq.gz = 214567. 2_3.fastq.gz = 214191. At which point I can consider my samples really filtered?

sentence: --detect_adapter_for_pe required for --adapter_fasta ?; I have some paired-end reads I'd ideally only supply --adapter_fasta. fastp only appears to trim if I also add the flag --detect_adapter_for_pe. This doesn't appear to be the documented behavior. Thanks,. Geoff.
author: OpenGene

sentence: --detect_adapter_for_pe required for --adapter_fasta ?; I have some paired-end reads I'd ideally only supply --adapter_fasta. fastp only appears to trim if I also add the flag --detect_adapter_for_pe. This doesn't appear to be the documented behavior. Thanks,. Geoff.

sentence: FASTP output fails to align using STAR; Hi, I have tried to trim and filter reads by length using Fastp, but to no avail. . The program runs successfully, but my downstream alignment results is near-zero aligment percentage (using STAR, a popular RNA-seq aligner) . I cannot see any problem in Fastp's output FASTQ format, and using other programs the same samples are successfuly aligned after trimming and length filtering. . Any input on the matter would be appreciated, once this is resolved I would like to incorporate Fastp in all my analysis pipelines. Example of reads which could not be aligned after processing:. **Mate 1**. `@SRR3184286.sra.1259451 1259451 length=100. GCCTGAGCACACACACACATTCCACACGCATCATTAAAGGATAGCCATTTATTCTTCATAGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCACGT`. `+SRR3184286.sra.1259451 1259451 length=100. BBBFFFFFFFFFFIIIIIIF0BFIIIFIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIFIIIFIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFBBBFFBFFFFF`. `@SRR3184286.sra.1259452 1259452 length=100. TCTCAACACCCGCCCCCCCCATGTTTAAACTTTGTGCCTTTGACCATCTCTTAGGTCTAATGATATTTTATGCAAACAGTTCTTGGCCCCCTGAA`. `+SRR3184286.sra.1259452 1259452 length=100. <BBBBBBBBBBFFBFFIFFFF<<FFF<BF<BFFB<<<B<BB<BB7B<<0<BB''<07<<0B070<BBBBFBBBF<<0700<<0<0''00077000`. **Mate 2**. `@SRR3184286.sra.1259451 1259451 length=100. GCCTGAGCACACACACACATTCCACACGCATCATTAAAGGATAGCCATTTATTCTTCATAGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCACGT. +SRR3184286.sra.1259451 1259451 length=100. BBBFFFFFFFFFFIIIIIIF0BFIIIFIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIFIIIFIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFBBBFFBFFFFF. @SRR3184286.sra.1259452 1259452 length=100. TCTCAACACCCGCCCCCCCCATGTTTAAACTTTGTGCCTTTGACCATCTCTTAGGTCTAATGATATTTTATGCAAACAGTTCTTGGCCCCCTGAA. +SRR3184286.sra.1259452 1259452 length=100. <BBBBBBBBBBFFBFFIFFFF<<FFF<BF<BFFB<<<B<BB<BB7B<<0<BB''<07<<0B070<BBBBFBBBF<<0700<<0<0''00077000`. And after processing: . **Mate 1**. `@SRR3184286.sra.1259451 0:N: 00. GCCTGAGCACACACACACATTCCACACGCATCATTAAAGGATAGCCATTTATTCTTCATAGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCACGT`. `+`. `BBBFFFFFFFFFFIIIIIIF0BFIIIFIIIIIIIIIIIIII

sentence: FASTP output fails to align using STAR; Hi, I have tried to trim and filter reads by length using Fastp, but to no avail. . The program runs successfully, but my downstream alignment results is near-zero aligment percentage (using STAR, a popular RNA-seq aligner) . I cannot see any problem in Fastp's output FASTQ format, and using other programs the same samples are successfuly aligned after trimming and length filtering. . Any input on the matter would be appreciated, once this is resolved I would like to incorporate Fastp in all my analysis pipelines. Example of reads which could not be aligned after processing:. **Mate 1**. `@SRR3184286.sra.1259451 1259451 length=100. GCCTGAGCACACACACACATTCCACACGCATCATTAAAGGATAGCCATTTATTCTTCATAGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCACGT`. `+SRR3184286.sra.1259451 1259451 length=100. author: OpenGene

sentence: Does fastp remove reads failing a Chastity test?; Truly raw Illumina sequence reads can either pass or fail a Chastity quality test. It would be useful to know whether fastp filters out reads that fail the Chastity test, and (if it does) whether this is by default or controlled by some cryptic argument. What *does* fastp actually do with a mix of Chastity-passing and Chastity-failing reads as input?

sentence: Add args for adjusting mismatch number; - `--adapter_mm_freq`. - `--poly_g_mm_freq`. - `--poly_g_mm_max`. - `--poly_x_mm_freq`. - `--poly_x_mm_max`
author: OpenGene

sentence: Paired reads have different length; Hi,. I encountered the issue about "paired reads have different length" in some of my sequencing data. The data are PE reads. The fastp commands I used were as follows:. `fastp -i read1 -o read1.trim -I read2 -O read2.trim`
author: OpenGene

sentence: Does fastp first trim adapter then do length filter?; fastp will discard the reads which are shorter than 15 bp, and will trim adapter. But I want to know, does fastp first trim adapter then do length filter? For example, a raw read is 150bp long, after adapter trimming, it becomes 14bp long, so it will be discarded.

author: OpenGene

sentence: Symbolic links not working; Hi, thanks for developing `fastp`! I encountered an issue with symbolink links. Apparently, fastp is not able to follow symbolic links which is a little bit inconvenient and annoying for example when using workflow systems like `NextFlow` which heavily rely on sym links. I tested fastp on a PE read set. Processing the files directly works fine - providing fastp with sym links to these files does not result in any error but empty read files which is even worse in terms of debugging. Am i missing something? If not, is there an option to make fastp "symbolic link aware"? ```bash. ls -al. ... R1.fastq.gz -> ../reads-raw/R1.fastq.gz. ... R2.fastq.gz -> ../reads-raw/R2.fastq.gz. fastp --in1 R1.fastq.gz --in2 R2.fastq.gz --out1 R1.fastq.gz --out2 R2.fastq.gz --unpaired1 SE.fastq.gz --unpaired2 SE.fastq.gz --merge --merged_out M.fastq.gz --detect_adapter_for_pe --trim_poly_g --cut_front --cut_tail --length_required 21 --low_complexity_filter --correction. Detecting adapter sequence for read1... No adapter detected for read1. Detecting adapter sequence for read2... No adapter detected for read2. Read1 before filtering:. total reads: 0. total bases: 0. Q20 bases: 0(-nan%). Q30 bases: 0(-nan%). Read2 before filtering:. total reads: 0. total bases: 0. Q20 bases: 0(-nan%). Q30 bases: 0(-nan%). Merged and filtered:. total reads: 0. total bases: 0. Q20 bases: 0(-nan%). Q30 bases: 0(-nan%). Filtering result:. reads passed filter: 0. reads failed due to low quality: 0. reads failed due to too many N: 0. reads failed due to too short: 0. reads failed due to low complexity: 0. reads with adapter trimmed: 0. bases trimmed due to adapters: 0. reads corrected by overlap analysis: 0. bases corrected by overlap analysis: 0. Duplication rate: 0%. Insert size peak (evaluated by paired-end reads): 0. Read pairs merged: 0. JSON report: fastp.json. HTML report: fastp.html. ```
author: OpenGene

sentence: Symbolic links not working; Hi, thanks for developing `fastp`! I encountered an issue with symbolink links. Apparently, fastp is not able to follow symbolic links which is a little bit inconvenient and annoying for example when using workflow systems like `NextFlow` which heavily rely on sym links. I tested fastp on a PE read set. Processing the files directly works fine - providing fastp with sym links to these files does not result in any error but empty read files which is even worse in terms of debugging. sentence: Symbolic links not working; Hi, thanks for developing `fastp`! I encountered an issue with symbolink links. Apparently, fastp is not able to follow symbolic links which is a little bit inconvenient and annoying for example when using workflow systems like `NextFlow` which heavily rely on sym links. I tested fastp on a PE read set. Processing the files directly works fine - providing fastp with sym links to these files does not result in any error but empty read files which is even worse in terms of debugging. sentence: Filtering by maximum expected error; Great tool. It would be very helpful to implement quality filtering by maximum expected error as outlined here: https://www.drive5.com/usearch/manual/exp_errs.html. This quality filtering technique has shown to be superior to filtering techniques like mean Q-score. See here for reference: https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btv401. Would that be possible? Thanks a bunch,. Martin.

sentence: Win10 Portability improvement; usleep from unistd.h is deprecated in many releases. Any easy fix to use nanosleep instead is to add the following code to util.h:. ```c++. /* Replacement for deprecated usleep call in unistd.h */. inline int usleep( int usecdelay){. struct timespec delaytime;. int retval;. delaytime.tv_sec = usecdelay / 1000000;. delaytime.tv_nsec = (usecdelay % 1000000) * 1000L;. while (retval = nanosleep(&delaytime, &delaytime) && errno == EINTR);. return retval;. }. ```. With this change, the code compiles with standard cygwin64. I did not check your mingw technique. Could have done a pull request but it is so simple and may not be compatible with other platform releases so am simply reporting here. But if you want it submitted as a pull on util.h, I can submit it there. The program is giving consistent results compared to running it on a MacOSX machine. But seemed to take much longer. Need to investigate that further.

sentence: Win10 Portability improvement; usleep from unistd.h is deprecated in many releases. Any easy fix to use nanosleep instead is to add the following code to util.h:. ```c++. /* Replacement for deprecated usleep call in unistd.h */. inline int usleep( int usecdelay){. struct timespec delaytime;. int retval;. delaytime.tv_sec = usecdelay / 1000000;. delaytime.tv_nsec = (usecdelay % 1000000) * 1000L;. while (retval = nanosleep(&delaytime, &delaytime) && errno == EINTR);. return retval;. }. ```. With this change, the code compiles with standard cygwin64. I did not check your mingw technique. Could have done a pull request but it is so simple and may not be compatible with other platform releases so am simply reporting here. But if you want it submitted as a pull on util.h, I can submit it there. The program is giving consistent results compared to running it on a MacOSX machine. But seemed to take much longer. Need to investigate that further.
author: OpenGene

sentence: Add: interleaved output to a file; Hello There. Thanks for making this super useful and convenient tool. I would like to process an interleaved fastq file and save the filtered reads to a new interleaved file. Now it can only output to stdout. Could you add an option to save the results directly to an interleaved fastq file? Thank you so much!
author: OpenGene

author: OpenGene

sentence: Serve Plotly library using https?; We are hosting a Galaxy server, where the fastp tool is available. When visualising the fastp results inside our Galaxy server, we get an error because the Galaxy wrapper points to http://opengene.org/plotly-1.2.0.min.js (as of version 0.20.1). Our server is using secure http/https, and mixing http and https is not popular on most browsers these days. However, it seems that there is no valid ssl/https certificate on opengene.org. Would it be possible to look into this, and switch to https:// for the Plotly library?

sentence: split_by_lines Generates Non-Consecutive Segment Numbers and Not Documented; I noticed that `--split_by_lines` sometimes skips segments. Notice that segment 9 is missing in the example below. ```. $ ls Fastq_split/*SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003*R1*. Fastq_split/1.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz Fastq_split/4.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz. Fastq_split/10.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz Fastq_split/5.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz. Fastq_split/11.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz Fastq_split/6.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz. Fastq_split/12.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz Fastq_split/7.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz. Fastq_split/2.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz Fastq_split/8.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz. Fastq_split/3.SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz. ```. But, the number of lines is the same in the input file and the split files. ```. $ zcat Fastq_split/*SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003*R1* | wc -l. 1596040040. $ zcat Fastq/SP19_008632BD_HLKNYDSXY_AGCCTCAT-TCTCTACT_L003_R1.fastq.gz | wc -l. 1596040040. ```. Please document this quirk in the user guide because I terminated my analysis when I saw this. I used `-S 200000000`.
author: OpenGene

sentence: Trimming PE and SE reads in a single command?; Hello, . Is there a way to do PE and SE trimming and filtering with one command? Or would you need to do two rounds of trimming? fastp --in1 raw_R1.fq.gz --in2 raw_R2.fq.gz --out1 trim_R1.fq.gz --out2 trim_R2.fq.gz. fastp -i raw_SE.fq.gz -o trim_SE.fq.gz. many thanks,. Rick

sentence: Trimming hybrid data?; Is there a way to trim Illumina and SE Nanopore and/or Pacbio in a single command? Is nanopore/pacbio well supported with the standard command:. fastp -i raw_Pac.fq.gz -o trim_Pac.fq.gz. fastp -i raw_Nano.fq.gz -o trim_Nano.fq.gz. many thanks. Rick

author: OpenGene

sentence: "Adaptor or bad ligation of read X" report; Dear fastp Developers. Thank you for sharing this excellent software it's incredibly useful! I am currently doing some quality checking of a large dataset of libraries, and am encountering the above report for the first time. Usually Im used to seeing some Adaptor reported, but not this. Sometimes its just for read 2, sometimes for both reads. Can you suggest most likely/possible causes of this? . Is it a sequencing error (reads not reading correctly or fragments not binding to the flowcell) or library prep error, i.e expired enzyme or low concentration primers or multiple primer sets? Any insight would be much appreciated. Thanks and kind regards. Crystal

sentence: length_required?; I set --length_required=36 for filtering PE fastq file , the length of each of my reads is 150 bp. but the resuts show . reads too short: | 37.530764 M (63.431066%). I want to confirm this length limit, whether it means filtering after trimming or filtering before trimming? The results show that it seems to be filtered after trimming.

sentence:
Not trimming low quality bases; . Hello,. I am using the following command and parameters to run fastp. It is not clear why fastp is unable to trim low quality bases even though I am using the parameters (--cut_right and --cut_front) to do that. Please check the quality score images attached below for the data before and after trimming. Kiran. 
. fastp -i DRR040425_1.fastq.gz -I DRR040425_2.fastq.gz -o DRR040425_1.trimfp.fastq.gz -O DRR040425_2.trimfp.fastq.gz --html DRR040425.fastpReport.html --json DRR040425.fastpReport.json --unpaired1 DRR040425_1.unpaired.trimfp.fastq.gz --unpaired2 DRR040425_2.unpaired.trimfp.fastq.gz --adapter_fasta /home/apps/software/Trimmomatic/0.38-Java-1.8.0_152/adapters/TruSeq3-PE-2.fa --cut_front --cut_front_mean_quality 30 --cut_front_window_size 1 --cut_right --cut_right_mean_quality 30 --cut_right_window_size 1 --length_required 30 --qualified_quality_phred 30 --unqualified_percent_limit 30.
. **Before trimming:**. ![Before_trimming](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28570913/111826033-36380b00-88b6-11eb-9ded-3f3510469f8c.png). **After trimming:**. ![After_trimming](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28570913/111826048-389a6500-88b6-11eb-83e4-31d524516480.png).
author: OpenGene

. fastp -i SRR1046114_1.fastq.gz -I SRR1046114_2.fastq.gz -o SRR1046114_1.trimfp.fastq.gz -O SRR1046114_2.trimfp.fastq.gz --html SRR1046114.fastpReport.html --json SRR1046114.fastpReport.json --unpaired1 SRR1046114_1.unpaired.trimfp.fastq.gz --unpaired2 SRR1046114_2.unpaired.trimfp.fastq.gz --adapter_fasta /home/apps/software/Trimmomatic/0.38-Java-1.8.0_152/adapters/TruSeq3-PE-2.fa --cut_front --cut_front_mean_quality 30 --cut_front_window_size 1 --cut_right --cut_right_mean_quality 30 --cut_right_window_size 1 --length_required 30 --qualified_quality_phred 30 --unqualified_percent_limit 30.
. **Before trimming:**. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28570913/112195084-8c1ef280-8bd7-11eb-983d-3fc1ac2cdf14.png). **After trimming:**. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28570913/112194885-58dc6380-8bd7-11eb-9332-564895ccc26b.png).
author: OpenGene

sentence: Trimming adapter sequence with Ns; One of the fastq files I'm processing was carried out using the NEXTflex™ Small RNA-Seq Kit for library prep which uses an adapter sequence with Ns in it . NNNNTGGAATTCTCGGGTGCCAAGG. I tried passing this through fastp --adapter_sequence but I get the error . ```. ERROR: the adapter <adapter_sequence> can only have bases in {A, T, C, G}. ```. I also tried trimming the non-N version of the adapter then trim 4 bases off the tail but it seems fastp trims the tail first then trims the adapter so this doesn't work. ```. --adapter_sequence=TGGAATTCTCGGGTGCCAAGG --trim_tail1 4. ```. Is there any way of processing this fastq file using fastp? Thanks!

author: OpenGene

sentence: Low complexity filter and contaminant removal; Thanks for a super nice tool. I wonder, if the following to functionalities could be included into fastp. 1) A low complexity filter using methods such as Entropy or Dust. The current filter does not work well on tandem repeats and similar type of low complexity sequences. 2) Removal of contaminants like PhiX. I always see some level of phix remaining in the files that come from the sequencing provider and a functionality in fastp would remove this in the same go as the other steps performed by the tool. Separate mapping e.g. via Bowtie2 is quite slow. Thanks for considering these options. Kind regards,. Martin

I always see some level of phix remaining in the files that come from the sequencing provider and a functionality in fastp would remove this in the same go as the other steps performed by the tool. Separate mapping e.g. via Bowtie2 is quite slow. Thanks for considering these options. Kind regards,. Martin

sentence: improvement in fastqreader; Hello, I have 2 suggestions:. 1. Could FQ_BUF_SIZE be passed in by options? In network file systems, it is very useful to reduce read frequency. 2. If the .gz file broken ( frequently occurs in downloaded files), gzread will return Z_BUF_ERROR (-5), no correct error report in the stderr, and fastp return 0 that it can't detected failure in working pipeline. Could fastp return error in this case？
author: OpenGene

sentence: Changing ID during merging leads to 'corrupt' fastq-files; Hello there, thank you for fastp. I have used it for roughly a year and am very happy with it. However, there is one thing that bugs me. When fastp is called to merge paired-end files, it also changes the descriptor on the id-line. I couldn't find an option to turn off this behaviour. When I tried using cutadapt after merging it wouldn't let me, because the description is not the same as the ID line. To be honest, I think cutadapt should print a warning and be done with it. They are kind of right though, as according to most sources, + should either be followed by the id or just with a \n. Please let me know what you think, all the best!
author: OpenGene

sentence: Add a feature to sample a fixed number of reads; Sometimes it's nice to sample a fixed number of reads from many libraries during analysis. I think it's not important that the *exact* number of reads be the same for every library, which should allow more efficient sampling approaches. E.g. it might be possible to do this in one pass using the file size and the first N reads to estimate the total number of reads. Specifying a fraction of total reads is fine, but harder to use.
author: OpenGene

sentence: Exit with error code after gzip file read fail or throw "ERROR: sequence and quality have different length:". Add reads buffer size parameter.; #333 . I managed to complete it by myself. Please review it. And I found it will core dump or segment fault if not exit after gzip file read fail or after throw "ERROR: sequence and quality have different length:" error. Exit with error code (-1) will walk around of these kind of core dump.
